title: Replace marshalling with JSON and payloadizers
body:
I heard that the use of Marshall was one of the things you didn't like about Rails 4 Queue implementation as it was.

So I took a stab at changing to JSON.  Get's kinda tricky...

What do you think?

title: Transparently upgrade signed cookies when setting secret_key_base
body:
Re: #9740

This pull request introduces a new `UpgradeLegacySignedCookieJar` that is automatically used instead of `SignedCookieJar` when both `secret_token` and `secret_key_base` are present.

Currently, signed cookies generated by a Rails 3.x app will be invalidated by setting `secret_key_base`. This new cookie jar avoids this issue by transparently upgrading legacy signed cookies much like the `UpgradeSignatureToEncryptionCookieStore` does for legacy cookie-based sessions.

I noticed this issue when upgrading Basecamp to Rails 4 and I've avoided setting `secret_key_base` pending a fix for this issue. 

@neerajdotname kicked things off and @jeremy provided some guidance along the way. Thank you!

@spastorino asked to be notified when this pull request is ready, so here we go! 

This PR also introduces a `ChainedCookieJars` module in response to this commit 2b773e148b56e0cff3b07ef1902311688fb9fed8. @jeremy suggested this would be an improvement in that is eliminates some duplication, and I agree. This ensures that chained cookie jars will always be initialized using the correct options. 

@jeremy and I also discussed and agreed that it makes sense to remove the `method_missing` calls introduced in that same commit as the methods have not been deprecated, but rather have simply been removed. I think the `method_missing` calls added unnecessary confusion -- better to just raise an exception which should be self-explanitory.  

--

On a somewhat separate note, @spastorino, I'd like us to consider tweaking the way that the session-based cookie upgrade process works. I'm thinking we could allow the user to leave their app configured to use `session_store :cookie_store` instead of asking them to change to `session_store :upgrade_signature_to_encryption_cookie_store`.

I think we can assume that the user wants to avoid invalidating legacy cookies when upgrading. We can tell if someone is upgrading by the presence of the legacy `secret_token` . So, much like this PR does, perhaps we could detect this state and switch to using the new `upgrade_signature_to_encryption_cookie_store` automatically? 

Let me know what you think about this PR and about this possible additional improvement to the cookie-based session upgrade process. I'm happy to work up a PR for that separately, but I thought it would be smart to bring it up now.

title: Fix bug with nested conditions passed to .where()
body:
Recusion in PredicateBuilder.build_from_hash() so that passing a nested
hash of conditions to .where will build a valid SQL query.
This allows queries like these:

  Post.joins(author: :organization).
    where(authors: { organizations: { name: 'Acme' } } )

This would fix issue #9511
https://github.com/rails/rails/issues/9511

Previously, that same query's WHERE clause would read:

"... WHERE "authors"."organizations" ...

which would break because the 'authors' table doesn't have an 'organizations' column. This change will instantiate an Arel::Table for 'organizations', and the query will be built correctly.

title: Fixes action_view issue where pages do not render due to NoMethodError
body:
The detail_args_for method, without this fix, results in a NoMethodError there are no options being passed into it as it tries to execute the empty? method on a nil object.

The exact error that I used to get was the following...

Completed 500 Internal Server Error in 17ms
NoMethodError (undefined method empty?' for nil:NilClass):
actionpack (3.2.13) lib/action_view/lookup_context.rb:145:indetail_args_for'
actionpack (3.2.13) lib/action_view/lookup_context.rb:139:in args_for_lookup'
actionpack (3.2.13) lib/action_view/lookup_context.rb:109:infind'
actionpack (3.2.13) lib/action_view/renderer/abstract_renderer.rb:3:in find_template'
actionpack (3.2.13) lib/action_view/renderer/template_renderer.rb:34:indetermine_template'
...

title: Ignore pkg folders
Change default SecurePassword column name
body:
Currently the ActiveModel::SecurePassword module force to create a requires you to have a password_digest attribute. This patch provide the option to switch the attribute name

```ruby
class Visitor
  extend ActiveModel::Callbacks
  include ActiveModel::Validations
  include ActiveModel::SecurePassword

  define_model_callbacks :create

  has_secure_password(validations: false, column_name: :password)

  attr_accessor :password, :password_confirmation
end
```

title: Add a test to assert autosaving associations doesn't overwrite id accessor methods
body: This is a bug on v3.2.13 (reported in #9130 ) where newly created associations will overwrite directly set ids. It seems to be fixed on 3-2-stable but this will help with regressions.

title: Custom index type support with :using.
body:
This is an updated version of #9451.Add custom index type with :using key
    
    add_index(:wikis, :body, :using => 'gin')

title: activemodel/CHANGELOG typo and change in test description
Unscoped works with other named scope even without block form
Don't use hash fragment for travis link
PUT requests have no content when using respond_with
body:
explanation in rails/rails#9862

Basically, when using the default responders, have it return the resource from a PUT request the same way it does when POSTing.

title: Fixed typos in activerecord CHANGELOG
Put coffee-rails in top-level of generated Gemfile
body: The goal is for a vanilla app to render coffee templates in production the same as it does in development and test.  As far as I can tell, that simply means moving coffee-rails from :assets to the top-level.

title: Refactoring validate_missing_parameters to validate_required_parameters.
body:
Inside of assign_attributes, there is a method which checks to make sure that particular parameters exist. The previous method name was ``validate_missing_parameters!`` and sounds like some parameters should be missing, when in fact it's meant to check to make sure none of the parameters passed in as arguments are missing.

Because of this, I think that ``validate_required_parameters!`` is a more apt name. I also removed a space in the middle of an empty hash.

title: Fix rake test warning in activerecord
Restore columns dropped by hstore test
body:
Disabling the hstore extension during testing created order dependent
test failures.

One way to view the problem in master is:
```
ARCONN=postgresql bundle exec ruby -wI.:test -e "%w{test/cases/adapters/postgresql/hstore_test.rb test/cases/schema_dumper_test.rb}.each { |f| require f }"
```

title: test-case to prevent resetting associations when preloading twice.
body:
The test-case was extracted from #9870 

Conflicts:

	activerecord/lib/active_record/associations/preloader/through_association.rb
	activerecord/test/cases/associations/eager_test.rb

title: StringIO is not required by default in JRuby
do not reset associations when preloading twice.
body:
Closes #9806.

As the `through_options` always contained `{:order=>nil}` the second time,
the preloader ran, the association was always reset. This patch only
adds the `:order` to the `through_options` if it is set.

This is a regression and the problem was introduced with #9322

title: Removed unnecessary block
body: Removed unnecessary block from the test case.

title: Removed unused loop variable
body: The loop variable is not used in the test case. So it's been removed.
